review: Setup was a breeze - connected and running in 5 minutes.  It actually performed well streaming movie and TV show content with a wireless connection (using TP-Link Archer C9 AC1900 Dual Band Gigabit Router on the 5 GHz band).  Haven't checked out the gaming features yet.  The voice command remote works well.  I tried it in a relatively quiet environment, so I can't vouch for its performance when there is plentiful ambient noise.  However, all the searches yielded the correct results based on spoken commands.  The packaging and device design are nice, and it made me think that Amazon is trying to mimic the quality feel of Apple devices (I have an Apple TV, iPhones, iPads, and a MAC Mini in the house).
author: Major Hochstetter "Genuine_TuffGuy"

review: I can't really knock the stars off for this but it runs Kodi pretty sluggishly sometimes. Subtitles, audio, and video are always out of sync but it was not really designed for that so oh well. I would look into disabling both hardware acceleration options. You have to go to Settings (make sure you are in expert mode) then video and hardware acceleration. Can't remember the options but I turned them both off and playback is smoother but not always perfect. I did the same for the Fire TV Stick as well.
